wikipedia_page.main: Henry William Mallin (1 June 1892 – 8 November 1969) was an English middleweight amateur boxer. He came originally from Hackney Wick, his younger brother was the Olympic boxer Fred Mallin. He lived in Dartmouth Park, North London and was a police officer with the Metropolitan Police.

response: He won a silver medal at the 1920 Summer Olympics, losing to British boxer Harry Mallin in the final. Prud'Homme later moved to Plamondon, Alberta and died in Athabasca, Alberta in 1978.
* Final: lost to Harry Mallin (Great Britain); Prud'Homme awarded the silver medal
He was selected for Canada's 1920 Olympic boxing team and assigned to its middleweight division.  At Antwerp that August, he won a bronze medal, only losing to Briton Harry Mallin in the semi-final.
He won a silver medal in boxing at the 1924 Summer Olympics in Paris, losing against the successful British boxer Harry Mallin in the final bout.
